speaker: Mary
text: *Mary takes a sip of her drink, eyeing Daniel with a playful look.* So, about that pool match... What would your wish have been if you had won?

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel smirks, leaning back in his chair and looking at Mary intently.* Oh, wouldn't you like to know?

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary chuckles, rolling her eyes.* Alright, alright. Keep your secrets then.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel leans in closer, a devilish glint in his eye.* Okay, if you really want to know... My wish would have been a night at my place. No strings attached.

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary chokes on her drink, her eyes going wide. She masks her surprise with a forced laugh.* Well, that would have been something, wouldn't it?

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel slams his glass down, his brows furrowed.* So you're just using me, huh? For free food and drinks?

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary chuckles, shaking her head at his absurdity.* Daniel, I assure you, I'm having a good time. I'm not leading you on.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel glares at Mary, clearly unconvinced.* You're just playing games with me. You have no intention of anything more, do you?

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary sighs, deciding to be honest with him.* Look, Daniel, I have feelings for someone else. You were a fun distraction, nothing more. You knew I wasn't looking for anything serious.

speaker: Daniel
text: *Daniel stands abruptly, his face flushed with anger.* You... You...!

speaker: Mary
text: *Mary winks at him, standing up herself.* And don't forget, Daniel, I won the second date fair and square. You knew what this was. I told you in my profile that I was only interested in something casual. *She walks out of the bar, laughing to herself.*
